scheme_name: Tailoring Training To Scheduled Caste & Backward Classes Widows/Destitute Women/Girls
description: This scheme in Haryana aims to enable Scheduled Caste (SC) and Backward Classes (BC) widows, destitute women, and girls to achieve self-employment by providing tailoring training and sewing machines. It promotes economic independence through skill development.
key_features: Free tailoring training for SC/BC women

benefits.equipment: Free sewing machine upon course completion
benefits.stipend: Monthly stipend during training, up to Rs. 1,000

community_criteria: Must belong to Scheduled Caste (SC) or Backward Classes (BC)
gender_criteria: Widows, destitute women, or girls aged 18-45 years
residency_criteria: Must be a resident of Haryana

steps: Obtain the application form from the District Welfare Officer or Social Welfare Department
Submit the application with proof of eligibility
Attach required documents, including caste certificate and residency proof
Applications are reviewed by the Social Welfare Department
Selected candidates are enrolled in training programs
application_process.note: Applicants must commit to completing the training program

special_notes: Sewing machines are provided only upon successful completion of training
Priority is given to economically disadvantaged applicants
Training centers are located at district levels
